title.narrative: Enhanced Justice Sector Services Project - Mongolia

description.narrative: To enhance access to justice sector information and legal advice and increase the efficiency and transparency of the courts and court enforcement agencies.

title.narrative: Improvement of court enforcement agency facilities

actual.value: Construction in Bulgan Aimag to be finished by the project's closing date.

title.narrative: Development of case management software for administrative courts

comment.narrative: Target to be met by September.

actual.value: Software is installed on a virtual server. Contractor ready for roll-out and training sessions. Most administrative courts shouldbe using the software by September.
4 court buildings are finished; completion of the refurbishment is expected by the project's closing date.

title.narrative: Connect Courts, CDEA, prosecutors via fiber optic cable

actual.value: By June 12, 2013, 90% of the courts and CDEA offices were connected via fiber optic cable (prosecutor opted out of the project).

title.narrative: Increased access to legal information and legal advice

baseline.value: 0 publications or other public education material for each value, N/A % of population reached by TV spots, 0 # of minoritypopulation served by legal aid center (by gender), 0 % of rural population with access to paralegals, # of rural populationactually servedby paralegals (by gender)

comment.narrative: Target partially met. More date expected in September.

actual.value: 50,000 leaflets distributed on 25 selected issues each across the country; 4,000 information posters on legal information websitedistributed across the country; legal comics provided to grade schools; “Your Legal Guide” developed around 7 subjects withcorresponding DVD.In 2013, 8967 Kazakhs served and 137 Mongolian ethnic minorities served.

comment.narrative: The paralegal program was discontinued in early 2013; activities expected to be picked up in the state budget.

baseline.value: 0% of CDEA officers trained (in new proceedings)

actual.value: All CDEA officers; all officers trained on current and upcoming legislation and soft skills, including ethics.

baseline.value: 31 syllabi and 14 handouts developed within the previous WB project but not regularly used

target.value: 9 new syllabi, 26 course handbooks completed, # of courses that apply new syllabi and handouts increased by 5%

actual.value: 8 new syllabi distributed to Law Schools in May.23 handbooks will be completed and distributed by June 30, 2013.

comment.narrative: 8 syllabi, 23 handbooks completed and used in all 13 law schools; 1 syllabi and 8 handbooks dropped by the client due to changesinthe relevant laws.

title.narrative: (ii) Local Courts submit electronic case data to the GCC

baseline.value: No electronic case data system in place

target.value: 60% of courts submit monthly case statistics electronically to GCC

actual.value: 100% of courts submit case data by GCC website.

comment.narrative: With the new software and fiber optic linkages, real time case management will be possible.

title.narrative: (i) Data and statistics on enforcement of court decisions is shared regularly between the CDEA and GCC

baseline.value: No regular sharing of data and analytical results between the agencies

target.value: - Both agencies submit quarterly data reports to the other. - Both agencies compare quarterly data and discuss analysis.

comment.narrative: End target expected to be achieved by September.

actual.value: MoU signed on May 29, 2013; exact data to be exchanged still to be identified.

comment.narrative: Both agencies exchange data irregularly. The new software will provide required information to both agencies.

title.narrative: Development of standards for Legal Clinics Implemented

target.value: # of legal clinics comply with standards increased to 8

actual.value: 10 Legal Clinics comply with legal standards.

title.narrative: (iii) court decision enforcement processes are unified and monitored for effective enforcement

target.value: 60% of locations using new system, 10% increase in successful enforcements over previous year

comment.narrative: Enforcement effectiveness data should be available by September 2013.

actual.value: Online system still in testing phase; roll out will begin on June 16, 2013.

comment.narrative: Once 18 out of 21 Aimags are fully connected, more than 60% of the locations will be able to use the new system.Enforcement datacollection is done manually currently.

title.narrative: (iv) Access to legal information and advice increased across all UB districts and Aimags

baseline.value: No value related information available, no paralegals are available, No information in minority languages available

actual.value: Legal advice available via Legal Aid Centers in 21 Aimags and 12 legal clinics in UB.Leaflets and posters on different legalissues provided to all UB districts and Aimag centers; legal comics and posters provided to public schools across thecountry; "YourLegal Guide" distributed to all Aimags.Kazakh legal glossary and 14 laws in Kazakh distributed plus additional legal infoprovided in Kazakh.Paralegal activities have been discontinued under the project but will be resumed under the state budget.
